arts.ttl: The lowdown on Chelsea 3 Wolves 1 - Blues get back to winning ways in the league
arts.sum: Five minutes later and the points were as good as sealed when Madueke nodded over the line from a yard after Trevoh Chalobah had headed a Cole Palmer corner back across goal. Chelsea: Sanchez, James (Disasi 76), Tosin, Chalobah, Cucurella, Caicedo, Dewsbury-Hall (Gusto 76), Madueke (George 84), Palmer (Felix 84), Pedro Neto (Sancho 61), Jackson.

arts.ttl: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye move for Wolves star Cunha
arts.sum: Arsenal have ramped up their interest in Wolverhampton Wanderers forward Matheus Cunha, while Barcelona have added Bayern Munich's Jamal Musiala to their shortlist amid plans to make a marquee signing in the summer. The Gunners are believed to be interested in a potential move for the 25-year-old as manager Mikel Arteta looks to reinforce his forward line, however it is reported that it would take a "crazy" offer in excess of £80 million to persuade Vitor Pereira's side to let the Brazil international go in the middle of the season as they look to avoid relegation from the Premier League .

arts.ttl: Wolves need to be consistent for 90 minutes - Pereira
arts.sum: Wolverhampton Wanderers manager Vitor Pereira says his players "need to be consistent for 90 minutes" after their 3-1 loss at Chelsea.

arts.ttl: Chelsea’s Noni Madueke ordered to improve work rate by boss Enzo Maresca
arts.sum: Maresca said Madueke ‘stopped playing a little bit’ after scoring in the win over Wolves.

arts.ttl: Lemina will not play in transfer window - Pereira
arts.sum: Wolves midfielder Mario Lemina will not play for the club until the January transfer window closes, says boss Vitor Pereira.

arts.ttl: Vitor Pereira admonishes Matheus Cunha for behaviour after Chelsea defeat
arts.sum: The forward stormed down the tunnel after the final whistle ignoring Wolves’ travelling supporters

arts.ttl: Sanchez clanger, VAR, two goals in five mins! Chelsea beat Wolves to go fourth
arts.sum: Highlights of the Premier League match between Chelsea and Wolverhampton Wanderers.

arts.ttl: Chelsea 3-1 Wolves: Player Ratings as Blues Win First Premier League Game of 2025
arts.sum: Chelsea dispatched Wolves 3–1 and returned to winning ways in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Chelsea’s surprise ‘signing’ Trevoh Chalobah offers versatility to regain momentum with Wolves win
arts.sum: Chelsea 3-1 Wolves: The Blues ended a five-game streak without a win with Chalobah shining for the hosts after being recalled from his loan spell at Crystal Palace

arts.ttl: Chelsea 3-1 Wolves: Highlights, man of the match, stats as Trevoh Chalobah impresses on Stamford Bridge return
arts.sum: Chelsea celebrate their first Premier League victory of 2025 after sweeping past Wolverhampton Wanderers via a 3-1 scoreline at Stamford Bridge.
